org.locationtech.geowave.core.store.api

Interface DataTypeAdapter<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of entries that this adapter works on.
    All Superinterfaces:
    DataReader<Object>, DataWriter<T,Object>, Persistable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    GeotoolsFeatureDataAdapter<T>, HadoopDataAdapter<T,W>, IndexDependentDataAdapter<T>, InitializeWithIndicesDataAdapter<T>, InternalDataAdapter<T>, RowMergingDataAdapter<T,M>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataAdapter, BinaryDataAdapter, DistortionGroupManagement.DistortionDataAdapter, FeatureDataAdapter, GeoWaveAvroFeatureDataAdapter, ImageChipDataAdapter, InternalDataAdapterWrapper, RasterDataAdapter, SimpleAbstractDataAdapter

    public interface DataTypeAdapter<T>
extends DataReader<Object>, DataWriter<T,Object>, Persistable
    This interface should be implemented by any custom data type that must be stored in the GeoWave index. It enables storing and retrieving the data, as well as translating the data into values and queries that can be used to index. Additionally, each entry is responsible for providing visibility if applicable.

    • Method Detail

      • getTypeName

        String getTypeName()
        Return the data adapter's type name. This also must be unique within a datastore.
        Returns:
        the type name which serves as a unique identifier for this adapter

      • isCommonIndexField

        boolean isCommonIndexField(CommonIndexModel indexModel,
                           String fieldName)
        Determines if a given field is part of the given common index model.
        Parameters:
        indexModel - the index model to check
        fieldName - the field name
        Returns:
        true if the field is used in the common index model

      • getPositionOfOrderedField

        int getPositionOfOrderedField(CommonIndexModel model,
                              String fieldName)
        for efficiency we assume fields have some pre-defined ordering. If the field belongs in the common index model it should be one of the first n positions where n is the number of fields in the common index model.
        Parameters:
        model - the index model
        fieldName - the field name
        Returns:
        the position

      • getFieldNameForPosition

        String getFieldNameForPosition(CommonIndexModel model,
                               int position)
        Get the field name for the position
        Parameters:
        model - the index model
        position - the position
        Returns:
        the field name, if its part of the common index model, it should be the common field name
